main event: A visual observation of an unidentified flying object was reported on March 18, 1962, at approximately 12:30 AM from East Orange, New Jersey.
interesting points: The object was observed visually and on ground radar,The object moved with intermittent bursts of speed over approximately 3 minutes,The object disappeared from both visual and radar observation,There were originally 4 objects observed, and then a 5th one appeared later in the same direction,The observer described the object's light as brighter than the brightest stars.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object exhibiting rapid movement
witness description: a 10-year-old male from East Orange, NJ
